alert.note: Alert for Stanislaus (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 4:44PM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Calaveras, Stanislaus and Tuolumne. * WHEN...Until 745 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 443 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated very heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in flooding of poorly drain areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sonora, Calaveras Big Trees SP, Chinese Camp, Springfield, Tuttletown, Moccasin, Keystone, Carson Hill, Vallecito, Jupiter, Forest Meadows, La Grange, Smith Station, Avery, Dorrington, Jamestown, East Sonora, Columbia, Phoenix Lake- Cedar and Soulsbyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
